title: PM Dashboard API Not Running - Blocking All QA Browser Tests
issue: PM Dashboard API (port 3456) is not running. QA agents cannot create test users or authenticate for browser testing.
impact: BLOCKING - All UI tickets requiring browser testing cannot be verified. QA agents forced to violate SOP (code review only).

human_actions_required.label: Start PM Dashboard (Recommended)
human_actions_required.description: Start the PM Dashboard API server
human_actions_required.note: Should start on port 3456. Verify with: curl http://localhost:3456/api/health

human_actions_required.label: Provide Test Credentials
human_actions_required.description: Manually create test user in Supabase and provide credentials
human_actions_required.action: Create admin user, provide email/password to agent

human_actions_required.label: Accept Code Review Exception
human_actions_required.description: For TKT-089 specifically, accept code review as QA evidence (violates SOP)
human_actions_required.note: QA agent confirmed implementation appears correct via code inspection

human_actions_required.label: Deploy to Staging
human_actions_required.description: Deploy branch to staging environment with existing test users
human_actions_required.action: Manual deployment and testing in staging

qa_sop_violation: Per QA SOP: 'If your evidence is "I read the code", your QA is INVALID.' UI tickets REQUIRE browser testing.
process_improvement: Consider adding PM Dashboard to agent launcher script so it auto-starts with agents
recommended_solution: Option 1 - Start PM Dashboard. It's needed for all future QA work anyway.
affected_acceptance_criteria: AC1: Switching from blocklist to allowlist preserves blocklist selections
AC2: Switching from allowlist to blocklist preserves allowlist selections
AC3: Can switch between modes multiple times without losing data
AC4: Saving updates the database with the currently active mode's list
code_quality_note: QA agent's code review shows TKT-089-V3 implementation appears correct with proper dual-state tracking. Just needs browser verification.
